text: The Labour Party (, literally "Party of the Working People") is a social democratic political party in the Republic of Ireland. It was founded on 28 May 1912 in Clonmel, County Tipperary, by James Connolly, James Larkin and William O'Brien. The party was a part of the Irish Trades Union Congress. It was known as the "democratic socialist party" in its creation. ==References== Category:20th-century establishments in the Republic of Ireland Category:1912 establishments in Europe Category:Political parties in the Republic of Ireland
title: Labour Party (Ireland)
